grid

Class Grid

  • java.lang.Object
    • grid.Grid
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IGrid

    public class Grid
extends java.lang.Object
implements IGrid
    A grid that consists of squares.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Grid(java.util.Map<Coordinate,SquareContainer> grid, java.util.List<SquareContainer> startingpositions)
      Create a new grid with a specified grid and player map.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Grid

        public Grid(java.util.Map<Coordinate,SquareContainer> grid,
    java.util.List<SquareContainer> startingpositions)
        Create a new grid with a specified grid and player map.
        One should not use this constructor. Use a builder and a director instead.
        Parameters:
        grid - a map that maps the coordinates of each square to the actual square itself
        startingpositions - a sorted list of all the startingpositions on the grid (from smaller to larger).

    • Method Detail

      • size

        public int size()
        returns the number of squares in this grid. If the grid contains more than Integer.MAX_VALUE elements, returns Integer.MAX_VALUE.
        Returns:
        the number of squares

      • getGridIterator

        public java.util.Iterator<SquareContainer> getGridIterator()
        Returns an iterator over all the squares in the grid. There are no guarantees concerning the order in which they are returned.
        Returns:
        an iterator over the squares of this grid.

      • getSquareAt

        public SquareContainer getSquareAt(Coordinate coordinate)
        Description copied from interface: IGrid
        Return the square of the grid that has a specific coordinate. This method returns null if the location doesn't exists on the grid.
        Specified by:
        getSquareAt in interface IGrid
        Parameters:
        coordinate - The coordinate of the square.
        Returns:
        The square at that coordinate or null if the location doesn't exists.

        Overrides:

        public int getHeight()
        This method will return the number of rows in the grid.

      • getWidth

        public int getWidth()
        This method will return the number of columns in the grid.
        Returns:

      • getAllGridCoordinates

        public java.util.Set<Coordinate> getAllGridCoordinates()
        Description copied from interface: IGrid
        Return all the possible coordinates in the grid.
        Specified by:
        getAllGridCoordinates in interface IGrid
        Returns:

      • getAllStartingPositions

        public java.util.List<SquareContainer> getAllStartingPositions()
        Get all the starting positions. The list will be sorted by their startingposition number (from smaller to larger).
        Returns:
        a sorted list of all the startingpositions on the grid.
